Jokowi soal 'Desa Hantu' di Sultra: Kejar dan Tangkap!
06 Nov 2019, 14:58 by Andhika Prasetia
Jakarta - Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi) meminta aparat mengusut soal ditemukannya empat desa fiktif atau 'desa hantu' di Sulawesi Tenggara (Sultra). Ia memerintahkan pelaku ditangkap.
"Tapi tetap kita kejar agar yang namanya desa-desa tadi diperkirakan, diduga itu fiktif ketemu, ketangkep," kata Jokowi di Jiexpo Kemayoran, Jakarta Pusat, Rabu (6/11/2019).
Jokowi membeberkan ada puluhan ribu desa di Indonesia. Tidak mudah untuk mengelola banyaknya desa yang ada.
"Manajemen mengelola desa sebanyak itu tidak mudah. Tetapi kalau informasi benar ada desa siluman itu, misalnya dipakai plangnya saja, tapi desanya nggak bisa saja terjadi karena dari Sabang sampai Merauke, dari Miangas sampai Pulau Rote sebuah pengelolaan yang tidak mudah," ujar Jokowi.
Sebelumnya, soal 'desa hantu' diungkapkan Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati mengungkapkan bahwa saat ini banyak muncul 'desa hantu'. Desa tersebut muncul tiba-tiba demi mendapatkan alokasi anggaran program dana desa yang sudah dijalankan pemerintah. Hal itu diungkapkannya saat melaporkan evaluasi kinerja APBN Tahun Anggaran 2019 di ruang rapat Komisi XI DPR RI.
Sementara itu, Menteri Dalam Negeri (Mendagri) Tito Karnavian mengatakan Kemendagri juga bekerja sama dengan pemerintah provinsi untuk mengecek seluruh desa di Indonesia. Jika terbukti ada pelanggaran, Tito meminta Polri mengambil tindakan hukum.
"Sudah, sudah bergerak, tim kita sudah bergerak ke sana bersama Pemda Provinsi, Kapolda Sultra Pak Merdisyam, sudah tahu juga ini ada empat yang diduga katanya itu fiktif atau nggak ada penduduknya tapi diberikan anggaran, ini kita cek," kata Tito kepada wartawan di Mako Brimob Kelapa Dua, Cimanggis, Depok, Rabu (6/11).

(dkp/haf)

Jokowi on 'Ghost Village' in Southeast Sulawesi: Chase and Catch!
06 Nov 2019, 14:58 by Andhika Prasetia
Jakarta - President Joko Widodo (Jokowi) asks officials to investigate the discovery of four fictitious villages or 'ghost villages' in Southeast Sulawesi (Southeast Sulawesi). He ordered the perpetrators to be arrested.
"But we are still pursuing that the names of the villages were estimated, it is suspected that it was fictitious to meet, be caught," Jokowi said at Jiexpo Kemayoran, Central Jakarta, Wednesday (11/06/2019).
Jokowi revealed there were tens of thousands of villages in Indonesia. It is not easy to manage the many villages.
"Management of managing as many villages as that is not easy. But if the information is true there is a stealth village, for example, just using the signpost, but the village cannot happen because from Sabang to Merauke, from Miangas to Rote Island, a management is not easy," Jokowi said.
Previously, the issue of 'ghost villages' was revealed by Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati, revealing that currently there are many 'ghost villages'. The village appeared suddenly in order to get a budget allocation for the village fund program that has been run by the government. He revealed this when reporting on the evaluation of the performance of the 2019 Budget Year State Budget in the Commission XI DPR RI meeting room.
Meanwhile, the Minister of the Interior (Mendagri) Tito Karnavian said the Ministry of Home Affairs also worked with the provincial government to check all villages in Indonesia. If it is proven that there was a violation, Tito asked the National Police to take legal action.
"Already, already moving, our team has moved there with the Provincial Government, South Sulawesi Regional Police Chief Merdisyam, we already know that there are four allegedly said to be fictitious or there are no residents but given a budget, we will check," Tito told reporters at Mako Brimob Kelapa Dua, Cimanggis, Depok, Wednesday (6/11).
